decision_conditions: The proposed rear extensions, by reason of its height, bulk, depth, design and scale would fail to harmonise with the original building on the site and would constitute an incongruous and dominant addition to the building and local area that is detrimental to the characters of the original building and the conservation area and would result in being out of keeping with the character and general pattern of conservation area. As such, the development would therefore fail to comply with would be contrary to the NPPF (2021), policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and the Norwood Green Conservation Area Management Plan. | The proposed development, by reason of its size, scale, height, and its proximity to site boundaries, would adversely affect the residential amenities of neighbouring properties. The proposed development would appear overdominant and overbearing when viewed from neighbouring properties, and would result in creation of enclosure and loss of outlook to those properties. As such, the proposal is contrary to policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and SPD4.
description: Part single and part two storey rear extension (following demolition of rear conservatory and garage)
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
